name: Patterson Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of months ago, I heard about this newly restored mansion-turned-into-inn on Capital Hill, and immediately booked a room even though the website wasn't fully functional and did not have room pictures yet. The owners preserved many interior architectural details, though some are no longer in their original locations. The innkeepers on duty gave us a tour of the house: all the rooms are beautiful, though some have better views than others. We stayed in No. 9, the smallest room in the inn, on the third floor tucked under the roof. It faced front with a view of the Capital dome. Though small, it was comfortable and well-furnished, and had a large, beautiful bathroom with a cast iron clawfoot tub, thick towels, and plenty of storage space with the double vanity. The bed, being new, was very comfortable, with good pillows and nice linens.
reviews.title: Wonderful historic inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn is in the final stages before its official launch, so there are some bugs to work out. The good: the innkeepers on duty were really friendly, loved the afternoon wine and nibbles, the hot/cold water dispenser and ice machine on each landing, the air conditioning, the eco toilet. The inn also served a delicious (and generous) continental breakfast of coffee, juice, fresh fruit, pastries, granola, and yogurt. The (minor) peeves: given that there were the hot/cold water dispensers, it would have been nice to have had an accompanying selection of tea also on hand, if not on the landings, then in the dining room. As for the AC, it would have been good to have room control -- AC was not needed on the cool fall evening, and we would have loved to have slept with the window open for some fresh air. It would also be nice to have a lighter blanket alternative available in the closet -- I love goose down comforters, but it was not cold enough for down and not warm enough for sleeping under just a sheet. Finally, we really liked the location of the inn, but parking was a bit of a nightmare, not surprising given the age of the neighborhood and its very narrow streets. The B&B does have 3 off-street parking spots but when we arrived all three were occupied by staff.
reviews.title: We celebrated our Anniversary at the Patterson and we loved it!

reviews.text: Over all, we enjoyed our stay, and look forward to coming back in the near future to try out the other rooms.
reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great stay last weekend: here's our review from bedandbreakfast.com: Having already been given a tour of the Inn, we were excited to book a room (The Prague) for our anniversary. It is a beautiful place and the innkeepers were very nice and accommodating. We were given another brief tour and told about some of the history of the building and the renovation. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. Overall, a very comfortable, enjoyable and historically interesting place to stay. Definitely recommended! For those interested in the "haunted history," I think I saw one (friendly)!
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Project
Just Gorgeous.....Historical
reviews.text: Stayed at the newly remodeled Patterson Inn for 4 nights in late August. The hosts were incredibly nice and helpful. When we arrived we were greeted promptly and shown to our room. We were also given a tour of this remarkable Inn and I can honestly say there is not a single room I would have been disappointed to have. We stayed in the Antoinette, which was on the main floor. I never heard any noise from any other guest and the room was very spacious. The room Davinci is also on the main floor and the next time we are there, I will be staying in that room. Incredible. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Breakfast was always fresh and there were plenty of options. There are three parking spots reserved for guests on the property, but there is also street parking. We didn't really walk to anywhere but we drove all over Colorado and the location of the Inn is perfect. Easy access to everything. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Denver and I would recommend it to friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a gorgeous old mansion, beautifully renovated into a new B&B. The architecture inside and out is a treat to behold. Each room is unique--we were in the Prague suite for 3 nights. Comfy king bed, HUGE bathroom with a spacious shower stall and a separate tub with hand-held shower. Nice toiletries and towels. Hair dryer (but not a very powerful one). In the summer there's a lot of morning light that comes thru the highest windows, so late sleepers might prefer a different room. Would have liked a sitting area in the room--some other rooms have one--but we enjoyed the comfortable seating in the basement pub.
reviews.title: Comfortable, lovely and friendly

reviews.text: Complimentary wine in the late afternoon. Lovely, sunny breakfast room and patio off it. Elevator to the 2nd floor but not the 3rd. Limited off-street parking on site, but unrestricted street parking and, in a pinch, complimentary spots at a garage a block away. Very convenient area--walk to restaurants, bars and a Whole Foods. About a mile to downtown area. The entire staff was welcoming and friendly, but must give special thanks to Kendyl and Doug! S&T
reviews.title: Beautiful 'home away from home' !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed 2 nights in the Chesire room at the Patterson Inn in Denver. We had three people in our party, and this is there only room that can accommodate three. The room was beautifully decorated, spotless, and the bathroom was big and gorgeous. There was PLENTY of room for three. The beds were outstanding. I was able to peak into a few other rooms, which were all unique and perfectly decorated.
reviews.title: 1st time in a B&B

reviews.text: The location is great, easy to get to all the fun parts of Denver.
reviews.title: LARGE ROOMS!

reviews.text: The hosts make you feel very comfortable and were incredibly nice! We loved our stay at the Patterson Inn, and will hopefully be back!
reviews.title: Perfection in the Prague Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enough with the stuffy and musty Victorian B & B image. The Patterson is a unique, Chateauesque boutique-like bed and breakfast, tucked in Denver's hip, urban Capitol Hill area. I can't wait to return in the summer or fall so we can go out and explore the neighborhood's eateries or even walk downtown. We were in the Antoinette room on the first floor and were delighted with it (the most inexpensive of the rooms). The attention to details are unbelievable; the decorator did an fantastic job in coordinating each room's ambience. The use of films to inspire each room's theme is done in a clever and classy sort of way--no tackiness here! The Patterson is an immense house, but specs of dust were few and far between. We loved the plush linens, bedding, and towels. The breakfast spread was laid out buffet style, but it was a notch above a typical continental (quiche and french toast casserole were included). I always appreciate a substantial and hot breakfst--something more than I what I would do at home. The onsite hosts, Mike and Melissa, went beyond the call of duty and were clearly enjoying their roles (Mike spent over an hour giving us an insider's tour of the renovation, Melissa shared a recipe). Most B & B's are pricey anymore, and not a "cheap way to go". Still, we received so much more individual attention than one would get at an upscale hotel. It was a fun, romantic, way to have a special weekend. Plus, we were supporting an historically preserved property! This place has great potential as a venue for weddings, catered events, etc. I'm hoping it will be a success; it is a relatively new business and is finding its stride. The money spent restoring this place was phenomenal, I'm sure. Anyone staying here should appreciate that the Patterson is one more priceless mansion that has been saved from demolition.
reviews.title: Not your usual B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Inn while in town to watch Saints vs Broncos game. We prefer to stay in b & b's whenever possible and this inn was truly special. The renovation is excellent and the inn is conveniently located near restaurants, shops, etc.
reviews.title: Patterson Inn Perfection...

reviews.text: We were pleased by the friendly and attentive staff who were more than capable at dealing with our various requests/needs. My hubby and I were in the middle of 2 stressful moves so we came to the inn in desperate need of quiet time. I'm so happy to report that the inn did not disappoint.
reviews.title: Wonderful library room!

reviews.text: Our room had enormously high ceilings and gorgeous furnishings. The towels & linens were plush and soft. We had such a relaxing weekend (minus losing our football game-lol) that we were refreshed & ready to face our ongoing moves.
reviews.title: Over-priced and doesn't possess that B&B ambiance yet

reviews.text: We were so pleased with our stay that we wouldn't hesitate staying at the Patterson Inn the next time we visit Denver. We can also highly recommend that anyone else do the same.
reviews.title: The Amazing Patterson Inn

description: A stately and distinguished National Landmark, the Patterson Inn is situated on a quarter acre of exquisitely landscaped grounds in the heart of one of Denver’s original high-end neighborhoods. Historically intriguing yet complete with all the comforts of modern amenities, it offers a luxurious reprieve from the stresses of everyday life.
